Summary: Great hotel close to the beach and local restaurants and shops. Rooms were very clean and the Hotel staff was very friendly and attentive. Breakfast was a pleasant surprise, with a good selection of beverages and food. I will be recommending this hotel to everyone I know.
Manager Response: Thanks for the time you took to give us this awesome review, we truly appreciate it!

Summary: I booked a room here for a small party with about 15 people attending. The staff was super friendly and welcoming, and surprisingly we didn't have any noise complaints! The location is really convenient and there's a lot of different places that are within walking distance. The rooms were very tidy except the balcony doors had some issues opening, but it wasn't a big deal. It was nice that we could hook up our gaming consoles to the tv and that there was free wifi. My friends really enjoyed hanging out in the jacuzzi at night and they were all interested in staying here in the future! I would definitely recommend staying at this place!
Manager Response: We're pleased to hear that you and your party enjoyed your stay! As we are working on improving our balcony doors, we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: My husband and I love staying at the Pacific Inn. It's only two blocks from the beach, and Main St. has lots of great restaurants! The hotel staff is really nice and friendly and they really do make your stay the best possible. The best part for us is they allow dogs and doesn't matter their size, we have two big dogs and it's hard finding hotels that will allow them! I definitely recommend the Pacific Inn for anyone traveling through Long Beach or Huntington.
Manager Response: I'm glad you always seem to enjoy your stay, Ashley! We look forward to having you, and your two dogs, with us again!

Summary: The hotel was convenient to down town restaurants and shops.  It had an enclosed pool and jacuzzi on the second floor....unusual but private.  Breakfasts were standard fare (coffee, cereal, pastries) in a very small room.  The price was high given the quality but inline with other California hotels.
Manager Response: We appreciate the review Ida. We hope to see you again, and if there's anything we can do to make your stay more enjoyable never hesitate to ask!

Summary: When staying in Seal Beach my family always stays here, great location, clean, friendly staff and close to almost everything in Seal Beach. Bathrooms are recently renovated, beds are comfortable.. for the price you cant go wrong, get the “junior suite” its worth the few bucks extra if you are going to be spending any real time in the room otherwise the regular rooms are more than adequate.
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review Aaron! We're glad your family is continuing to enjoy their stays with us and look forward to seeing you again sometime soon.

Summary: I ended up here on business and I must say I was pleasantly surprised. The room was clean and comfortable and the price was very good for the area. I will definitely stay again in the future. It's a short walk to the beach and many restaurants. The breakfast wasn't that great but hey for $130 who griping. The pool and Jacuzzi was a lot nicer than I thought. I would give the desk clerk 5 stars she was great. I didn't like the parking situation very much and when I arrived there was a few rather unfriendly looking gentlemen out front socializing (I assume guests that were construction workers of some sort). If your looking for a holiday inn type of place near seal beach this hotel is for you.
Manager Response: We're so glad you enjoyed your stay! We hope to see you the next time you're in Seal Beach!

Summary: The first room we got was being worked on so we had to go back down stairs to get a new room. Our new room had dirty walls & they never gave us clean sheets. I have stayed at this hotel before & had never had a problem before. who ever is in charge of cleaning the rooms needs to learn how to clean them correctly.
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear you were displeased with our facilities during your stay. I assure you that these are not the standards we hold as our hotel and will see about improving our thoroughness in cleaning our rooms. As for the maintenance, we are in a constant state of improving and modernizing our facilities so I do apologize that this maintenance interfered with your stay. As you have stayed with us before without this problem, I hope that you will choose to stay with us again in the future to see this problem eliminated.

Summary: the seal beach inn is my top pick for any one spending time in seal beach Great location for all visiting Long Beach, Huntington Beach  and surrounding areas It is A unique boutique hotel with that special ambiance that truly  has the spirit of the beach Walking distance to Main Street -- restaurants--Walts Wharf-- a favorite for the seafood-- Carmelized salmon-- my ultimate favorite.  The take a walk down to  pier :)))) I have stayed at the pacific inn many times over the past ten years..  Even had my husbands 60th birthday party in the   two suites:))).  Love the  Admiral Suite as well as the family suite- many parties over the years My number one pick when staying in the seal beach -long beach area  All the rooms have balconies. Love the street side - the side on the entrance
Manager Response: I'm glad you are continuing to enjoy your stays with us, RenoCowboy! We look forward to seeing you the next time you're in Seal Beach.

Summary: Best location in seal beach.We have stayed here several times and have never been disappointed.The staff has always been super friendly.This hotel is pet friendly and you never notice that people have dogs.
Manager Response: We're glad that you enjoyed your stay! Thanks for the great review!

Summary Heading: Great location, it ain't no boutique hotel .
Summary: Stayed for 6 nights in August 13. It's true it's a great location, rooms ok but with a vey odd bathroom with a sliding door and no inside handle. Balcony door is as old as the hotel and tricky to shut and lock. Renovations look like the maintenance man did them, not a professional. Pool space just weird with big beams covering the area And not much sun.  Breakfast a poor affair.... For goodness sake buy an industrial toaster.  It's an ok motel in a nice spot.
Manager Response: Kingomor, we greatly appreciate the time you took to give us such a detailed review. We'll be taking these notes into consideration to further improve our facilities. Thank you again for the review.

Summary: We booked 15 rooms at the Pacific Inn for classmates that were traveling in to attend our class reunion.  The hotel staff were incredible--catering to our every need.  They allowed us to use the pool area for a Friday night cocktail party--brought in tables and chairs, and checked on us several times to make sure we had everything we needed. The rooms were clean and kept up.  Shuttle service was provided--the the breakfast area was well stocked and convenient.   Pacific Inn is a wonderful place to stay--highly recommend staying here.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review dmenne! We're glad that you and your classmates enjoyed everything we have to offer and enjoyed having you stay with us. We hope to see some of you again!

Summary Heading: Convenient location for long beach with friendly staff
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights during the dragonboat festival in long beach with many other teammates. Great location with nearby historic seal beach to explore. The free shuttle service to and from the airport is convenient.  The shuttle drivers were all very nice and always tried to accommodate requests to and from Marine stadium for our race. The coffee maker that brews fresh Starbucks coffee in the hotel lobby was a bonus and was better than the coffee at breakfast.  Standard continental breakfast fare - breads and bagels, cereals, fruit and yogurt. The king room was adequate with a balcony for laying out wet stuff, but only the parking lot view so not really for sitting out on. The bathroom in our king room has a large shower with good water pressure. The carpet was very dark
Manager Response: We appreciate the review, Homesteader1! We're glad that you enjoyed the amenities that we have to offer here at our hotel. Also, we are aware that our carpets are not quite up to date with the rest of our facilities and plan to replace the carpets in all of our rooms very soon. We hope to see you and your team for next year's Long Beach dragonboat festival.

Summary: Had a family vacation using three rooms.  Great location, close to cute old town Seal Beach with shops and restrants.  Close walk to the pier and beach. Nice small pool in a patio setting, also good for reading and eating breakfast.  Staff was very friendly.   Good for all ages.
Manager Response: We'e so glad to hear your family enjoyed their vacation, janice385. We hope you consider our location for future vacation getaways!

Summary: So sad to leave.  We have stayed at the Pacific Inn many, many times.  It is a wonderful and relaxing destination.  The room is clean and well maintained.  The entire staff is friendly and very helpful.  The breakfast is quick with a nice variety.  Hope they bring back the waffles. Will definitely being staying there again.  We are planning a Dec. getaway. Can't wait:)
Manager Response: Dear rlipschutz- We're ecstatic to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us once again. We are in the process to adding a new freshly made option to our breakfast room, hopefully we will have it for you when you return in December. We look forward to seeing you again!

Summary: We had such a great experience we stayed an extra day.  Everything is in walking distance, the room was very clean and quiet.  I loved the pool and Jacuzzi as well as the staff.  A great Fathers Day weekend!
Manager Response: We're glad you enjoyed your stay, Richard, and we're glad we could accommodate to your needs. We hope you visit us again sometime soon!

Summary: Came here to stay with extended family for a family event.  More motel than hotel.  The front desk staff was friendly.  There is a breakfast room on the 3rd floor which is perfect for a light meal.  Small pool and hot tub were good for the group to meet and talk.  Just a few blocks from the beach and Main Street.  Seal Beach is low-key but Main St has loads of bars/pizza/sandwich/ice cream places to keep you busy.  If I were in the neighborhood again I would certainly come back.
Manager Response: Edwers, we appreciate the time you took to give us a review. We hope you do make it into the neighborhood again, as we would love to have you back!

Summary: Found this place through a friend who lives in the area. She checked it out and liked it. Only two blocks from the beach, right at edge of downtown Seal Beach which is a small but great town. My niece was on break from school and so we spent a couple of days there. Nice rooms, nice breakfast, and easy access to beach.
Manager Response: We're very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. If you enjoyed Seal Beach in October, you should definitely try to visit in the summer! We hope to see you, and your niece, again!

Summary: excellent and great staff.   No problems!   Close to the beach and restaurants in Seal Beach. would love to go again soon.    close to home also.  Thanks for everything!  We are now planning a trip in July   with my sister.  she likes coming too.
Manager Response: Hi Randi! We're glad that you enjoyed your stay with us in May. We look forward to seeing you, and your sister, in this upcoming summer season.

Summary Heading: Enjoyed our stay in Seal Beach
Summary: The Pacific Inn is an older hotel somewhat refurbished.  Overall, I enjoyed our stay & the reasonable room rates we had.  The parking garage is on the first floor (street level) & the hotel rooms are on the 2nd & 3rd floors.  The pool is on the 2nd floor & is partly open air so people using the pool can get sun mid-day.  All of the front desk receptionists were extremely friendly.  There was a PC in the lobby for guests to use.  We liked the small town atmosphere of Seal Beach & it was a pleasant walk to the "downtown" area.     The hotel has interior corridors but they are somewhat open to the elements in the area of the pool & wind can blow down the corridors from the partially open air stairwells.  This wasn’t a problem for us but it might be unpleasant during a windy
Manager Response: Dear Guest, we greatly appreciate the time you took to give us a review.  We're glad that you enjoyed some of the amenities that we offer at our hotel, as well as your stay with us. If you choose to stay with us again, we do actually have a hidden closet space located behind the sliding door to our bathrooms which can accommodate hanging clothes. We hope to see you sometime in the future!

Summary: Friendly staff, a clean room, and convenience to all things Seal Beach made our stay over Memorial Day weekend a great one!  The hotel is pet friendly, and our dog was more than welcomed for the duration of the stay.  I would definitely recommend The Pacific Inn and will stay again if I return to Seal Beach!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and choosing to stay at The Pacific Inn! We hope you had a great Memorial Day weekend and hope to see you again in the near future.

Summary: Pleasantly surprised by how nice this hotel was. The location was good; close to shopping, restaurants, and entertainment. The staff (Isaac, Eric, and that little hottie working the desk when we checked out) were very friendly and professional. The room we had was actually a spacious two room suite which was very clean, with a great bathroom, although the walls were a bit spartan. But, since I don't sleep on the wall, it wasn't a big deal at all. The Continental breakfast was filling and offered a good selection; breakfast burritos, cereal (including hot oatmeal), fresh fruit, pastries, and plenty of hot coffee. Never had a chance to use the swimming pool, but it looked clean. We would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Pacific Inn had everything I was looking for - great location in quiet neighborhood walking distance to the beach pier and shops. The room was nicely furnished, the bed comfortable, easy wifi and a nice continental breakfast. The staff was very friendly and helpful.  I will go back and highly recommend it.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review! We just recently replaced all of our beds so we are so glad that you enjoyed it. Thank you again for choosing to stay at the Pacific Inn and we hope to see you again soon!

Summary: Stayed here for a visit with my daughter.  Clean, friendly staff, great location.  Reasonably priced, considering its location and amenities.  I would certainly recommend this to others staying in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comment! We are so happy that you enjoyed your stay here and hope you chose to stay with us again in the near future! Thank you again for your rewview!

Summary: Stayed here recently along with a wedding party.  Very friendly staff and very accommodating.  Good pool area for the kids (we also held a pre wedding party in this area).  Rooms very clean and spacious and nicely decorated.  Location was perfect, walking distance to the main street for numerous restaurants, bars and shops.  Beach and pier also in walking distance, plus the hotel provides a shuttle to take you to the beach with your beach toys, chairs, etc.  They also provide a shuttle to Long Beach Airport and the local downtown.  Plan to revisit very soon.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave a comment. I am so glad that you and your group had a pleasant stay. Please let us know if you need anything else for your future stay. We hope to see you again very soon!

Summary Heading: Always a great stay at The Pacific Inn!
Summary: I always enjoy my stay at The Pacific Inn - clean, well-appointed rooms, friendly, helpful staff, and walking distance to Main Street and the best that Seal Beach has to offer. Looking forward to my next visit!
Manager Response: Thank you for commenting and choosing The Pacific Inn as your place of lodging when you are in Seal Beach. Hope to see you again!

Summary: We had the "Admiral's Suite" for us and our 2 teenagers...it was perfect...we could go to bed and the kids could still be up watching tv in the next room, with the door open in between, so we felt secure.  It had a king plus refrigerator, etc. in one room, and the adjoining room had two queen beds.  We enjoyed it.  Also, computer in the lobby allowed us to do our own airline checkins.  Walked to LOTS of shops and restaurants, enjoyed all of our stay in Seal Beach.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We wanted to stay within walking distance to the beach and Main St and this delivered both for a very good price.  It's directly off the PCH (convenient) and a few blocks from great dining and shops on Main St (see other reviews).  You could see some minor aging around the hotel but the room was modern, clean and comfortable with a mini-fridge, microwave, free wi-fi, free parking and a free continental breakfast that had all the regular items plus microwave breakfast burritos and toaster waffles.  There is free Starbucks coffee avail 24/7 also.  The pool/hot tub area is awesome; very private in the center of the hotel with an open air roof-top.  It appears to be family owned and everyone I dealt with was very helpful and friendly.  My only criticism with the room is that I wish
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time out of your day to comment. We always love to hear that our guests had a enjoyable stay. Unfortunately all of the bathrooms have the same design and re all in the same area. However our Admiral Suite is separated and not all in one area if that is more of your preference. Hope to see you again soon!

Summary: Stayed here April 22 thru April 28. Great location! Walking distance to the beach, shopping and great places to eat. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Rooms were very clean. Loved having parking facilities. The continental breakfast had a good selection for being continental. Would definitely recommend staying here and will be back again next year!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to comment! We love to hear our guests feedback and we are so pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us. Can't wait until you visit again!

Summary: This place is the perfect place to stay at if you are going to participate in the Seal Beach Classic car show.  I did not win a trophy but the Inn won my trophy.  Front desk staff very nice and even brought up an item we forgot.   Great place to stay and we will be back next year......  Sugguestion: why dont you become a sponsor at the car show next year and give out a thophy in you name.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comment and suggestion for the car show! That is a great idea and will definitely take it into consideration, especially since we are so close to Main Street/ where the car show takes place. We hope you stay with us next year and we will be rooting for you at he car show next year!

Summary: I stayed here from April 24-25, 2013.   The hotel is not fancy, but it is in a great location, the staff was very friendly and the price was right.  It is within walking distance of the beach.  I would not hesitate to stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comment Reg D! We love to hear our guests feedback and we very much appreciate you taking the time to comment. Hope to see you again soon!

Summary: This hotel doesn't look like much from the outside, and the outdoor areas need some work,  but the rooms are great and bathrooms are very nice. Service was friendly and the free breakfast had a lot of variety for a continental. The location was perfect for walking Seal Beach and would make a great hub for a longer LA/OC vacation.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Wrote and review last year--worse now
Summary: Forget this place altogether.  If its all you can afford please go elsewhere.  Mold in the shower, dirty carpets, minimal parking.  Pool area is dirty and unkempt.  Noise level from pool area is horrible if druken people are there.  Had to stay there as company paid--will not stay there again.  Like I said last year--it must have been good in the 70s.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback. We take our customers’ problems seriously and are glad to hear from you. First of all we would like to thank you for choosing to stay at The Pacific Inn for your lodging accommodations for a second time and we are sorry to hear that you had another unpleasant stay.   Our property is an older building and was established 27 years ago and has been The Pacific Inn for about 10 years now. During this time we have done extensive renovations and updates to your rooms to ensure that we are providing the best services possible for our customers. Since we are an older building we do strive to always maintain and update the property. In your comment you mentioned that in your room the carpets were dirty and had mold in the shower and again I do apologize because that is not the standards we have. We do hire professional carpet cleaners as well as re-grout our showers every year to ensure that problems like these do not arise.  Please e-mail us back with the room you stayed in so we can make sure to address these problems. Since our pool is in the middle of our hotel I completely understand how it can get noisy especially if there are a lot of people going in and out of the pool. This is one of the reasons we have set hours where people can use our pool (between 6am and 10pm). We do have a bellman that monitors this as well as picks up the pool area but since he has many other jobs, he checks and cleans the pool periodically which is why you may have seen it a bit unkempt at that moment.  Again, thanks for taking the time to let us know how you feel. We appreciate customers who let us know when things are not right so that we can please our guests.

Summary: We have stayed here a few times over the past few years. And we were so pleasantly surprised by it. We weren't familiar with Seal Beach, but took a chance. It is a perfect little beach town that is hidden just south of Long Beach. You are close enough to the main freeways, and only about 20 minutes from Anaheim (Disneyland)!! And about 3 blocks from the beach, you can't go wrong with this place. The staff is very accommodating and the rooms have been upgraded and are always very clean. And another bonus, free breakfast!! You can't go wrong with waffles, juices, breakfast burritos and muffins. This will always be our go to place when staying in the L.A area.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comment and your feedback on our hotel. We are so glad that you found our hotel and enjoy the Seal Beach Area. If you choose to stay with us during the summer we offer bogey boards, chairs and towels for the beach!

Summary: We have stayed at this property many times while visiting our son and his family in Seal Beach. It is the perfect location to walk along Main Street. They offer free shuttle service as well! We wouldn't stay anywhere else in Seal Beach!
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Pacific Inn when you choose to stay in Seal Beach. Customer satisfaction and customer loyalty is our number one priority and if there is anything we could do to better your stay please let us know! We look forward to your next visit!

Summary Heading: Excellent location, very pleasant staff. Liked the Starbucks machine and fresh baked cookies
Summary: We spent 6 nights at The Pacific Inn. It met our needs very well. Very conveniently located within walking distance of tons of restaurants, shops, beach. Parking is included in the rate. Although not the most fanciest, the price was competitive, and I would stay there again.
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback and choosing to stay at The Pacific Inn on your vacation. We are so glad you had a pleasant stay and we hope to continue updating our rooms and our hotel each month. Thank you again for your comment!

Summary: This is our favorite hotel! When we make a trip for seal beach this is exactly where where we want to stay. Walking distance to the beach, clean, friendly. It's great! Will be back again for sure! Excellent hotel and I recommend it, highly!!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for commenting on our page, we love to see that our guests had a enjoyable stay. If there is anything we could do better to accommodate your next stay please let us know. Can't wait until you visit again!

Summary Heading: My favorite hotel in Southern California!
Summary: Best location! Close walking distance to Main St. Where there's great shops, restaurants and bars. And of course the beach. The rooms are modern and clean and the hotel feels very safe. It's a great hotel!!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your comment! We are so pleased you enjoyed your stay at our hotel and we can not wait to welcome you back!

Summary: We have stayed here many times over the years and always enjoy coming back.  We were in town to participate in the Seal Beach 5K, the best thing about this hotel is when we arrive, we park once and then we can walk to anywhere we want to go in Seal Beach.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback! We are so glad that everything worked out for you during the Seal Beach Race. Please think of us next year during race time, we would love to have you back!

Summary: We stayed here for the Run Seal Beach Race. The hotel is located in a prime spot between the start and finish line. The staff greeted us upon arrival with open arms and asked several questions about our stay. The room was comfortable, the beds were really nice. The complimentary breakfast was great. We had a light meal before the race and after the race it was still going on. Overall our stay was fantastic. We would have loved a bigger bathroom but we adjusted. Definitely would stay here again. Also, it is within walking distance to Main St. and the Pier.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comment! Guest satisfaction is our number one priority and we are so happy that everything worked out for you with the Seal Beach Race. We look forward to assisting you again when your travel plans bring you back to the Seal Beach area. Thank you again for your comment!

Summary: This was our final stop on a 10 week tour of the US, and we were not sure what to expect.   Luckily we were very impressed.   Seal Beach is a lovely little place with a real local community feel.  The hotel was very friendly and provided all that we needed.  A little sprucing up and refurbishment would help.  The pool area was lovely and open air.   The rooms were clean and value for money for this area it was a real find.   There was plenty fo choice for eating and we can recommend the pizza parlours, one was particularly gluten free friendly which was the best find.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing  to stay with us on your week tour of the US! We are very pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us. Please think of us next time you are in Seal Beach, we are more then happy to have you back!

Summary: This was our 1st trip to Seal Beach and we will definately be returning this summer!! we usually go to San Diego but wanted a change this spring break. The Pacific Inn was everything we hoped for and more! The staff was helpful and courteous, the location was perfect and the rooms were clean and cozy...definately a beach vibe right down to the tiki wood bathrooms :)) I have recommended it to friends and family! Awesome trip and look forward to returning in a few months :))
Manager Response: Thank you for commenting! We are very happy that you enjoyed your stay and can not wait until you visit us this summer. During the summer we supply bogey boards and chairs for you to take down to the beach, just ask the front desk if interested! Thank you again for your comment.

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for his birthday. It is a great location to shop or eat on the main street. They have a shuttle service within 5 miles. We used it to go to Belmont Shore. it was quick and the driver was nice. The room was average but clean. I expected a larger jaccuzi tub than online photo appeared, but it worked and was clean. The service at the desk was friendly and helpful.  There were some strange people across the hall from us that looked as if they were up to no good, but they were not loud or openly using drugs so we did not complain. Overall it was a good experience.
Manager Response: We are so pleased that you enjoyed your stay at The Pacific Inn. I hope your husband had a great birthday! I am sorry that our online pictures gave you a wrong impression about our jacuzzi tubs, we are currently getting new pictures of all the rooms so hopefully that confusion does not happen again.  If you are looking for a larger jacuzzi tub I would suggest checking out our admiral suite, it tends to have a larger size tub then our king rooms with the jacuzzi tub. We hope you visit us again!

Summary: Recently took a cruise out of San Pedro and booked a night at The Pacific Inn based on the previous reviews and the fact that the hotel provided a free shuttle from the Long Beach Airport and to the Cruise Ships in San Pedro which saved us $$$ in taxi fares. We found the hotel to be clean & comfortable.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  Only complaint was the use of sliding frosted glass doors from the room to the bathroom.  The hotel is in a perfect location and within 5 walking minutes to the Seal Beach Pier with little shops, restaurants and grocery stores.   We will stay here again the next time we are in town.
Manager Response: Thank you for feedback! We are so glad that you had a enjoyable stay with us and will be returning. If you ever need to take the shuttle elsewhere it does go anywhere within a 5 mile radius (drop off and pick up). Thank you again and will see you next time!

Summary: We have used The Pacific Inn as our home-base for over 8 years. We found it while searching for a play to stay with our dogs, and now we stay there with our kids. From the outside, and in the halls, it has a funky, casual beach hotel feel, but inside the rooms... modern and cozy. It's in walking distance from Main Street shops, and from the beach. Hop in the car and drive a few miles south to Dog Beach, situated between Huntington Beach and Bolsa Chica.
Manager Response: Thank for your comment! We are very appreciative that you have chosen to stay with us all these years! Guest satisfaction is our number one priority and please let us know if you need anything in the future. Can't wait until you visit us again!

Summary Heading: excellent getaway for an affordable price
Summary: The Pacific Inn is close to restuarants and walking distance to the pier. Seal Beach is a nice little town to dine and walk. The staff is friendly and helpful.  My husband and I loved our experience at the Pacific Inn.  We will return again and again.
Manager Response: We are so thrilled that you enjoyed your stay with us and can not wait until you visit us again!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but a little noisy
Summary: We stayed at the Pacific Inn when we traveled to So. California for a family wedding.  The staff is very nice & helpful (we had issues with the TV not working, the faucet on the bathroom sink was broken & we detected wafts of cigarette smoke coming from another room by or below us).  These issues were addressed promptly by the staff with the maintenance man fixing the TV in seconds, replacing the faucet completely & bringing in an air purifier to help with the cigarette scent.  Even after fixing all of the issues, they still offered to give us another room, which we declined.  The one thing that couldn't be fixed was how paper-thin the walls are in this hotel!  We could hear activity in the parking lot & kids screaming & running down the halls (don't need paper-think walls for
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the feedback! We are so sorry about the noise level. It is our goal to have every guest have a enjoyable stay with us as well as a good nights sleep. Since the breakfast room does open early we will be sure to help monitor the noise level so this does not happen again. Currently we are undergoing some renovations such as the doors to the guests rooms and hallways as well as some deep cleaning in the rooms. We will make sure that by the next time you visit us these problems will be solved!

Summary Heading: Excellent location~walk to restaurants,shops and the beach!
Summary: My mother, my daughter, and I had a nice stay at the Pacific Inn in Seal Beach this last weekend. It was our first "girls weekend" trip together and we wanted a safe neighborhood within walking distance of restaurants, shops, grocery stores, the beach and the pier.    The staff was very helpful. There is a computer and printer available next to the front desk which was helpful in printing boarding passes. The breakfast was standard but did offer waffles which we enjoyed.  The free breakfast for two at Hennesey's was also basic but was a change of venue and offered omelets and potatoes. We didn't use the pool but we used the jacuzzi and it was nice.  The inside/outside courtyard pool atrium was a nice place to relax.  The Pacific Inn fulfilled all of our expectations.   Our room
Manager Response: We are so happy that you enjoyed your stay! Currently we are working with carpet as well as furniture cleaners to give your room that deep clean you were looking for. It is not our standards to have any type of remnant from prior guests and will make this a priority that this does not happen again. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Excellent location, wonderfull staff but needs updating
Summary: Owner: Please put some money back into this hotel. I've been staying at the Pacific Inn for years. The location is the best (walking distance to restaurants and nightlife in downtown Seal Beach), the staff is wonderful (couldn't be nicer), but the carpet is worn, low water pressure in shower, screen door from balcony would not operate, veneer missing from furniture and paint missing from walls.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback! We loving hearing any feedback from guests to help us improve to make our guests stay 100% enjoyable. Since this is a older property, we are always looking for ways to update the property. Currently we are re doing all of the guest rooms doors as well as both of the floors hallways. We are also currently talking about redoing all of the screen doors as well. Hopefully all of these renovations will be completed by the next time you visit us to make your stay more enjoyable!

Summary Heading: Excellent spot to relax and reconnect
Summary: Looking for a quiet place with great service? Try this place close to beach,  vintage shops. Clean rooms good price. I'll give this place 3 + stars easy.  6 visits and still a bargain. The staff is very friendly and always willing to shuttle you to locations near Seal Beach.   Oh yea Free parking and WIFI.
Manager Response: Thank you for your postive feddback! We are so happy that you keep thinking of The Pacific Inn when you come visit Seal Beach. We cant wait until you come and visit again!

Summary: We just spent four wonder days in quaint Seal Beach, CA.   We stayed at the Pacific Inn and can't tell you how much we enjoyed it.  The front desk staff we more than helpful when asked of a good restaurant we could walk to.  Just across the street are several.  The include fast food and fine dining.  We settled on Fin Bar's.  This italian restaurant has been in Seal Beach for over 15 years and what a delight.  When you register with them you get a free breakfast included with your room however they also give you a card for free breakfast at Hennesseys on Main street.  A pleasant four block walk from the hotel.  The menu is yours.  FREE.  Best breakfast in town.  Hands down.
Manager Response: We are so happy you enjoyed your stay with us and appreciate the feedback. Having guests leave our hotel satisfied is our number one priority and anything we could improve on or make your stay even better just let us know! Can't wait to see you again!

Summary: What a little gem.  We were very pleaesd with the hotel and the staff. The staff was responsive to a need we raised and even followed up the next morning to ensure we were satisfied. Highly recommend staying here during your next visit to the area.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedback! We are so glad you enjoyed your stay and can not wait until you come visit us again!

Summary: The Pacific Inn is located close to Main Street with shopping and restaurants. It's a short walk to the Seal Beach Pier. The rooms have been refurbished with all we needed, flat screen tv, microwave and small refrigerator. Bathrooms are newly done. The style of our unit reminds me of a Hampton Inn. Very clean.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comment, it will be very helpful for other guests and travelers! We appreciate you giving us feedback because anything we can maintain or improve on to make your stay better is our top priority. Hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Pleasant place to stay in Seal Beach
Summary: First time at the Pacific Inn on trip to visit Grandkids. Location, for me, is terrific--virtually across the street from their house for the general visitor quite convenient to the Main Street shopping district which has numerous restaurants of all types. The room was perfectly comfortable and seemed clean and well-maintained. The staff was pleasant. Free breakfast is exactly what you've already encountered in free breakfasts elsewhere---no better and no worse. Starbucks coffee machine in the lobby is a nice touch for a good cup of coffee any time you like. There is a smallish pool and hot tub but January weather discouraged it's use so I can't comment but the area surrounding is nicely furnished with various lounges and couches and would be nice in the summer. For the quality
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your comment and feedback! We are so pleased you enjoyed your stay and hope you visit us again soon!

Summary: We stayed here recently on a short visit to Seal Beach.  The property is older and shows wear around the edges but seems fairly well maintained.  Our brief interactions with the staff were pleasant and professional.  The room was clean and in good order, a bit sparse but not disappointing.  The beds were not the most comfortable but fine for one evening.  Our biggest complaint was the free breakfast...  pretty sad all things considering.  They had a small fridge with milk and juices but it was barely working... the milk was just a few degrees from being hot...  put a damper on the rest of the selections.  This is about the only choice if you want to be  within walking distance of  downtown...  and we would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback! The Pacific Inn is always looking for ways to improve and make our guests stay the best as possible. We will definitely take your comments about the breakfast room and adress them. Thank you again for your feedback!

Summary: I have stayed at the Pacific Inn several times in the past and been satisfied.  My most recent stay in December 2012 was very unsatisfactory.   1.  They need to shampoo the carpets which felt slimy in my room.  Perhaps allowing pets and smokers is making a difference in their ability to keep the carpets clean.  I felt the need to wear slippers at all times.  2.  Water was leaking from the toilet in the bathroom and over 5 days it was not repaired.  3.  The noise from other guests running through the halls, screaming and yelling and noise from the pool was VERY annoying.  I asked three different staff members to ask the guests causing the disturbance to be more quiet but over 5 hrs there was no change.  I asked them myself to be more quiet and respectful of others but to no
Manager Response: none

Summary: We visit our grandkids every couple months & have stayed here regularly for years. My 1st priority in a hotel room is a comfortable bed & we've always had that at the Pacific Inn! But there are numerous other things that keep us coming back. Wonderful, attentive service from everyone. They really care about your stay there. I much prefer staying in a small, independent hotel rather than a chain. Rates are very reasonable, the rooms are nice - perfect size & very comfortable for 2. The rooms have balconies and being close to the beach we always leave the balcony door open for fresh air. We can walk to the pier and shops easily. Easy driving to local attractions or other shops, grocery etc. Very convenient location. The continental breakfast is just fine with basic choices -
Manager Response: Thank you for taking your time and writing a review! We are so happy that you had a enjoyable stay. Can't wait to see you again!

Summary: The rooms are nice and updated. Continental Breakfast is ok. Shuttle service was fine. The driver was very nice. He dropped us off and picked us up at the Long Beach Port. He arrived on time with the shuttle bus. We were a group of 12 and we fit perfectly with our luggage. Would recommend staying there if you are going on a cruise. Parking is included.
Manager Response: Thanks Cristina for your review! We are so happy you enjoyed your stay and that everything worked out for your cruise. Hope to see you again!

Summary: My Trip took me to Denver then on to LA  where i stayed in Seal beach... the hotel was great. staff really nice this hotel is very clean also used the shuttle which is free i never had to wait and if i did this is ok as everyone in the hotel can use this service. i will for sure be staying there again
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback!  We are so glad that you enjoyed your travels to Seal Beach!

Summary Heading: Rooms are nice, shuttle service sucks.
Summary: The rooms were nice but the.shuttle service from the pier was beyond horrible.   We made reservations for a 9:30 pickup but they sent their minivan rather then.their big van to save a.few bucks on gas and.gave our seats to.another couple who had not.made.reservations and made.us wait an additional hour. Don't use these people unless you have two hours to wait for their shuttle.  Will not.use.them again.
Manager Response: Thank you Unkwes for choosing The Pacific Inn. I am pleased hear that you enjoyed the rooms during your stay. I understand that you were disappointed with the Free shuttle service offered to all of our guests, for which I apologize. Our shuttle service was already on its way to pick up other guests who had reserved the shuttle in advance when you called to inform us of your needed pickup, which was not reserved in advance as you mentioned above.  Our driver took the smaller of the two hotel vans, not to save gas, but simply because the group being picked up only had five guests.  When you called to inform us that there was not additional room for you on the shuttle, another van was immediately sent and you were pick around 10am, only 30 minutes after your "reserved" pick up time. This clarification of the actual events that occurred is not meant to discredit that there was a delay in you pick up, but to reveal your actual wait time which has been greatly exaggerated. I understand that any wait time is inconvenient and I am sorry that you had to wait for an additional half hour while other guests at the hotel were utilizing the Free shuttle van. We have created time specific logs to ensure that an issue like this does not arise in the future and appreciate you bringing this problem to the managements attention so it can be fixed.  We hope to be considered in the future for your lodging accommodations, now that this issue has been amended.

Summary Heading: Always a nice place to land in Seal Beach
Summary: Just stayed here for probably the 5th time in the last few years - 2 nights including Thanksgiving - it's our favorite place when visiting our son in Seal Beach.  Choices are limited right there in that great little town, but the Pacific Inn offers a decent price for nice rooms, an outstanding location, friendly staff, and an overall old-school small CA beach town feel.  Nice complimentary breakfast, rooms are nicely-remodeled and appointed, great pool/hot tub area in the center of the hotel, and parking right on site.  Not much not to like....
Manager Response: We are so glad that you enjoyed your stay at the Pacific Inn. Hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Wonderful Staff Really Make Your Stay
Summary: Unfortunately, we were only able to stay in this hotel for one night (October 29th).  We had had an unhappy stay at a motel near Disneyland and needed a room for our last night in California.  We picked this hotel because of it's proximity to Long Beach, where some of our party wanted to visit the Queen Mary the next day, and to the airport.  It had good reviews on Trip Advisor but so had the Anaheim motel that we were so disappointed with, so weren't sure what to expect.  We arrived at the hotel around 6 pm and were greeted by a very friendly girl at the front desk and were  promptly told  that there was a taco and pumkin carving party going on by the pool and we should feel free to attend.  We were travelling with a 10 year old, so she was thrilled.  We dropped our bags in our
Manager Response: We are so thrilled that you got to enjoy our taco party! We love when guests get to participate and hopefully you guys left full and happy.  For your next stay just ask the front desk about our Hennessey's breakfast passes because it allows two free breakfast at a local restaurant at Main and it comes with your room. Can't wait to see you again!

Summary: I stayed for 6 nights in November, booked a room with two XL beds which was suitable for two adults and two children. The room is fine, though the bathroom was not so well designed and the closet was tiny. There were sliding doors into the bathroom and clear sliding doors for the shower, and not enough towel racks.   The service provided by the Pacific Inn is excellent though. They gave us as many bottles of water as we needed and there is a beverage machine in the lobby and cookies in the evening. The free shuttle to town was also a big plus. Good selection for breakfast including egg burritos and waffles. We also used the coupons for free hot breakfast entrees at Hennessey's on main street twice, which were excellent, and we only paid for drinks and tips. This was valid until
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review. We are very happy that you enjoyed your stay and will definitely take into consideration some of your tips. In some of our rooms there is less closet space and we know that having adequate space  is an important feature in any hotel so we will do our best to try and update our amenities in those rooms. Hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: The Place to Stay in Seal Beach
Summary: I truly miss the old Seal Beach Inn, it was demolished in favor of condos; For  the past few years I've been staying at Pacific Inn at Seal Beach. The location is ideal. I adore Seal Beach.  Most of the rooms are quiet, especially if you request a room away from the atrium pool area.  The rooms are comfortable, modern bathrooms and each room has a small balcony. I like the rooms overlooking the neighborhood park. Morning breakfasts are generous and the coffee is good! What a love most is the proximity to the charming Seal Beach residential neighborhood and retail area, and the piers, the ocean. Morning walks are the BEST and can last until noon.  I'll always be faithful to The Pacific Inn.
Manager Response: We are so happy you enjoyed your stay with us and can not wait to have you back again!

Summary Heading: A little dated and tacky but overall fine
Summary: If you're visiting Seal Beach or nearby, this is a great location. Just a couple of blocks from historic Main St with all the shops and restaurants. And Main St goes right down to the water - I was disappointed I didn't see any seals :) but there's lots of sand and a pier to walk along.  The hotel itself had a confusing layout - it's sort of outside and inside at the same time. The doors to the rooms face in to an open-air atrium while the balconies face out to the streets (not exactly scenic and noisy with traffic). So there are no quiet, warm interior hallways. The postage-stamp size pool is in the atrium as well surrounded by deck chairs if you want to sit out in the sun without, well, sitting outside if that makes sense.  The room was clean and had been updated. There was no
Manager Response: Thank you Craig for your review. We are pleased you enjoyed your visit and your review is very helpful to us as well as to other travelers. Our hotel is uniquely shaped as a atrium and gives each room its own private balcony. For more of a view and less noisy I suggest to most guest to try and reserve a room facing the park. Again, thank you for all of your helpful tips and review, we greatly appreciate it!

Summary Heading: Lovely location close to Long Beach Basic Good Value hotel.
Summary: Stayed for 4 nights  in October. Family of 2Adults and 2 teenagers from UK sharing 1room. Booked direct with the hotel paid on arrival , very good value for money for 4 sharing. Special rate per room for 4 nights Room had a Fantastic new bathroom with big modern wet room / walk in shower. Very nice.  Booked 2 double beds but got I double and 1 very small double / large single. Not big enough for 4 so Hotel offered us an extra single folding bed which made the room very crowded.    Fridge/ iron in room. Air Con not very good but in October did not matter. Would not have liked to stay in room in mid summer. Rooms wee clean. Sheets were clean but poof bedding quality.   Decor was shabby throughout hotel needs further renovation and new carpets throughout. Staff were very friendly.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your helpful review!  The Pacific Inn  wants every guest to have a great stay with us and anything we could do to improve is beneficial.  We are currently in the process of re doing our carpets in the hallways and making sure each AC unit is working properly. We would love you to come visit again to see our new renovations!

Summary: Our room was a little tired this time around but I've learned it happens quickly with properties near water. As always the staff is fantastic and always willing to help. My husband was working so we took advantage of the shuttle to the aquarium - such a great deal for my young girls and me. The location is within walking distance to the water and main street with great shops and eateries.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback Jent.  Since we are by the water and get a lot of traffic going in and out of the hotel we always try to keep are room updated. We are currently working on a lot of new renovations to make our guests have the best stay possible!

Summary: My husband and I decided to do a one night get away to a So Cal beach town that we hadn't been to before - but didn't want to break the bank to do so.  After searching various websites, we chose The Pacific Inn - for the proximity to the beach and walkind distance to restaurants, nice hotel, and good price.  Unlike many beach hotels that upcharge for everything they offer, The Pacific Inn includes free parking, wi fi, breakfast, fitness facility, area shuttle (though we didn't use this) - all for about $100 on a Sunday night.  Hotel has remodeled all of their rooms, and is now working on updating the lobby area.  Nicely done - would go back, and I do recommend!
Manager Response: We are so pleased you enjoyed your stay with us! The Pacific Inn is constantly trying to provide great service and amenities to our guests. Come see us again soon!

Summary: Our biking group stayed for 2 nights & enjoyed very much.  Cooperative management, nice pool &good rooms.  Location is the best for restaurants & access to the river bike trail.  Seal beach is a charming town with many restaurants, walking distance.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comment! We always love when our guests have a great stay. We cant wait to have you visit again, your group was a blast.

Summary Heading: Nice place in a good location but needs more parking.
Summary: This hotel is a little hard to find, but overall, it was a very nice place.  The rooms are a little dated, but certainly fine for a few nights. The breakfast buffet is acceptable with no hot choices other than waffles.  But, for someone on business or in a hurry to get out and about, it was fine.  The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. They were renovating the lobby when I was there and that was a little annoying, but it didn't affect my stay on an upper floor.  The only thing that was a bit annoying was there is not enough parking for hotel guests. Two of the three nights we were there, we had to park on the street.  Not a big deal because the hotel is in a nice area, but if you were concerned about your car, you may not appreciate that.  Overall, a pleasant stay in a
Manager Response: Your comments have been very helpful! As you saw we are currently in the process of renovating our lobby and our rooms to give the hotel a more updated look. This work should be completed in about 2 months. But if it gave you any inconvience we are very sorry. Also the parking situation is now our number one priority because we do not want any of our guests coming to stay with us and not having a place to park. Hope to see you again soon!

Summary: We loved our week stay at pacific inn! there were so many extra's here. a fantastic breakfast every morning, hot tub and pool were clean and beautiful, warm chewy cookies and warm drinks after a day at the beach, along with a supply of treats daily made us very happy! Only a short walk to a big exciting beach and plenty of cool shops! Yes, we will make reservations agian soon!
Manager Response: We cant wait to welcome you back! We are so pleased you enjoyed your stay and anything we could do to make it better just let us know!

Summary: This hotel has an excellent location in Seal Beach. You can walk to shops, restaurants, beach, etc. The lobby area of the hotel looks a bit tired and could use remodeling. The rooms have been remodeled and are decent. We had a king room with a shower which worked great for us. The shower tile could use a little bleaching. The bed--super comfortable. The room didn't have a closet for hanging clothes or even a luggage rack.  My husband likes to be able to hang his clothes, but wasn't an issue for me. Our main complaint was parking. All 3 of the evenings that we returned to the hotel, there was NO parking available on the hotel grounds. The first night we went to talk with the hotel staff on duty and asked if we could park in the "registration" spot. He said that we could. The
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We are so glad you enjoyed most of your stay except for the parking issue. We understand that the lack of parking can be very frustrating, espseically since you could not find any spots 2 out of 3 nights you were here. Unfortunately we are a smaller hotel and have about one spot per room. When guests have more then one car it is unfortunate because that results in less parking for other guests. We are definately making parking a number one prority and making sure each guests uses their parking pass. We are confident that when you come visit us again this problem will be solved.

Summary: Very nice Hotel. Guest room attendants were excellent and kept our room neat and spotless. We appreciate the extra effort on their part. Enjoyed our stay very much and look forward to returning in the future.
Manager Response: none

Summary: When the free shuttle pulled up we thought the place looked like an older building and maybe we should have shopped more, then we noticed the building was well maintained.  Once we checked in and went to our rooms(our group had 3 rooms) we where amazed on how modern and nice of rooms we had gotten.  The staff was awesome, pool was nice(not as big as we thought from the pics) and rooms great, will stay again and recommend to friends
Manager Response: Thank you for your comment Terry! Since The Pacific Inn is a older building we are currently  making renovations to our lobby, hallways and front of the building. We hope we you visit again everything will be completed!

Summary Heading: Best location for Seal Beach. Period.
Summary: The location is what makes this place the best to stay in Seal Beach. The rooms are nice enough (average to above) but the location to the downtown area and the beach make this the best hotel to stay at if you're wanting to experience Seal Beach. The staff is really good - ready to pitch in to help you solve whatever your issue is (mine was unrelated to the hotel and they were really helpful!). I like being able to park there (no extra cost for parking) and just walk to the downtown and the beach. I have stayed there many times over the years and will continue to do so.
Manager Response: none

Summary: All staff was friendly and accomidating. Hotel is clean with beautiful decor. Location is excellent. Short walk to Seal Beach, Pier and to restaurants. Great free Starbucks coffee and hot chocolate in the lobby (cookies too) that is available 24 hrs a day. Nice Breakfast Room for free breakfast every morning. Some of the items included in the room was a microwave, fridge, 4 cup coffe maker, hair dryer iron/ironing board and a balcony with two chairs and small table. Relaxing heated spa. Nice 5 1/2 foot deep pool. Beds were extremely comfortable.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Pacific Inn at Seal Beach was in a good location, close to the beach and not a far drive to some decent restaurants. The hallways were kind of dated, but we were pleasantly surprised by the updated room we stayed in. It was spacious and modern and had everything we needed. The bathroom was large and had all the amenities. The staff at the desk was helpful and hospitable. Breakfast was provided down the hall, and staffed by a friendly lady. Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Randi, thank you so much for your comment! We always want to make sure our guests have a pleasant stay. In the upcoming months we are actually going to be re doing the hallways as well as the lobby to help update and brighten them up. We hope you come back and visit us and see our new renovations!

Summary: Spent a weekend here in early August and fell in love with this charming hotel and it's beautiful view. Comfortable beds and good coffee contributed to an awsome visit. Would have no hesitation returning to this great spot.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location for the three block walk to the pier, close to Main Street shops and restaurants, nice atmosphere and comfortable room with nice bed and balcony.  Request a room away from the elevator and on the third floor to diminish some of the street noise.  Loved the cookies most evenings when the staff put them out in the lobby as well as the automatic Starbucks coffee machine in the lobby!  Continental breakfast is well put together and opens early, even on weekends.  Nice covered parking at street level under the hotel. Loved the feel of this hotel for my ten days on business recently.
Manager Response: Thomas, we are very happy that you had a pleasant stay with us! Hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Perfect for a weekend trip with family!
Summary: We decided to stay in this hotel for our short visit because we knew of it's location.  As former residents of Seal Beach, we knew that this was closest to Main street and the Pier.  This time we had 2 kids in tow and were very surprised to be able to get the Family Suite.  This was basically a living room with a sofa and 2 chairs, table, TV, Balcony adjoined to a large bedroom with 2 beds.  While one part of the room seemed outdated, the bathroom was remodeled along with some other pleasant accents.  Overall, the room was perfect for a toddler and a crawler.    We also enjoyed the small pool, which was great for the kids, and it was not crowded either.  The breakfast buffet was a plus as well with a variety of options ranging from fresh fruit, bagels, make-your-own waffle,
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Pacific Inn Seal Beach is in a class by itself with regard to ambiance, amenities, comfort, and service.  From check-in to departure, feel like family who treated as honored guests.  For the past number of years The Pacific Inn has been the go-to destination when out-of-town visitors arrive--grandchildren enjoy short walk to the beach and strolling Main Street.  Also organized a memorable class reunion there; as a result, folks have made return visits to this premier destination hotel-- 'tis a favorite getaway spot!
Manager Response: Justin, we love your feedback and we are so glad that you enjoyed your stay. We always like to have guests leave happy and anything else we could improve on just let us know! Can't wait to have you back!

Summary: Great location! Kid friendly! Great walking location. The beach a little far to carry a lot of gear but close enough to walk to. Beds are super comfy! Close driving distance to Long Beach. They offered great prices for aquarium tickets. The pool was enjoyable and the perfect size to watch a fearless 6 year old swim. Overall my family really enjoyed our stay there and would stay there again in the future.
Manager Response: Faerietackman, thank you so much for your postive review! We are so happy that you and your family enjoyed your time here. We can't wait for you to stay with us again!

Summary: Loved it! It had been overdue for us to get to the beach and this was "just what we needed". One of our goals is to park the car and not need it again till we leave. That goal was met. A short walk to the beach then over to Main St. to enjoy Walt's Wharf, Hennessey's and the little bakery (great brownies). We spent some time at the pool and spa. Very quiet location. We even had breakfast on our balcony.  We hated to leave.  We'll be back to The Pacific Inn.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Quiet spot in crazy Southern California
Summary: We were looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a quiet area from which we could access the beaches to the south (which were packed with people and expensive hotels).  The Pacific Inn was just such a place.  Located in a quite residential area of the very attractive City of Seal Beach, this hotel is close to everything, but also an oasis of calm.  It is only a short walk to the beach or Main Street with many eateries.  It has free, mostly covered parking.  The room was fine with a small balcony. The continental breakfast was adequate. The staff were very friendly and helpful.  When we went into LA, Long Beach or hit the busy beaches to the south, it was good to kick back in Seal Beach at the Pacific Inn.
Manager Response: We are so glad you enjoyed your stay here and can't wait to have you stay with us again!

Summary: We usually go to Seal Beach to celebrate our anniversary each year, and we stay at the Pacific Inn.  It allows us to walk around town and the pier and eat at our favorite restaurants like Walt's Wharf.  But it's also close to Long Beach and Laguna Beach's Sawdust Festival.  Very friendly staff, nice room and a complimentary breakfast.  We also like to sit in the ocean air on the room's balcony.  Very nice hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: A fantastic location in seal beach . A five minute walk to the main street with lots of bars and restaurants and to the beach. There is a supermarket and pharmacy across the road plus various take always and drive throughs. The rooms are large and clean with a good shower and a fridge and coffee maker and balconys . Breakfast is provided  and  on arrival you have a token for a free breakfast in Hennesseys in Seal Beach. There is a small pool in the centre of the hotel . Beach chairs and umbrellas are available for rental from the front desk . The staff were all very friendly and helpful . There is Internet connection provided and a printer to use in the lobby . My only negative is the decor is crying out to be uplifted . Lighter paint and new carpets would transform this place .
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback! We love to hear guests responses so we can better all of our guests stay at The Pacific Inn. We will definitely take your comment into consideration as we improve and update the rooms. Hope to see you again soon!

Summary: Very reasonably priced, located a short pleasant walk to the beach.  Room clean and a pretty good size.  Nice little balcony.  Quiet.  Has wading type pool and an exercise room.  Plenty of parking in the lot and around the property.  Will come back!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Pacific Inn last weekend for 2 nights because we had family in town renting a beach house and we didn't want to have to drive home each night to South Orange County.  The Pacific Inn is a very nice small hotel for a great price. Very nice front desk people, clean rooms, comfy beds with nice linens and a very nice bathroom. No views to speak of but hey, it's a 2 minute walk to Main Street and the beach. I highly recommend this inexpensive but really nice hotel
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel's location can't be beat. Its within walking distance of Main Street and the beach.  You can park and literally never drive again. the rooms are all renovated, though our shower faucet was a little broken.  They could brighten the rooms up a bit, but the pool and jacuzzi are nice too. We had a wedding in Seal Beach three years ago and a lot of our guests stayed there as well and had good experiences.
Manager Response: none

Summary: everyone on staff was so friendly and made us feel great.  location ideal..my friends always stay here and have told us about it for years, but we finally made it.  Seal Beach is a very nice family community with lots of stuff to do.  There is a small park across the street from the hotel and also the library if you just want to chill out there for awhile.  concerts at the pier on Wednesday evenings....
Manager Response: Thanks for you comment! We can't wait until you stay with us again!

Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights last weekend. The hotel is as described in previous posts, older but nice. The location is fantastic, with main street and the pier just a 5 minute walk away.  Seal Beach is a hidden gem, I used to live in So Cal but never visited SB. It is such a wonderful little beach town. The staff of the Pacific Inn was incredibly friendly and helpful.  If I return to SB I will surely stay here again.  Highly recommended.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The location is only 3 blocks from main street, seal beach pier, and the beach. We arrived several hours prior to check in time but were provided a room several hours early without any additional fees.  The rooms are standard and the water pressure is very low.
Manager Response: Your feedback is greatly appreciated! We take guests feedback very strongly because we are always trying to make imporvements at the The Pacifc inn to better our guests stay. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: We stay at Pacific Inn every time we visit Seal Beach, where our daughter and her husband live. The hotel is small, casual and unpretentious. It is clean and comfortable with nicely appointed rooms. Baths are a step above the typical chain hotel, with an Asian Pacific decor and spa-like, spacious walk-in shower. Exceptional location that cannot be equaled. Walking distance to everything including restaurants, beach and Main Street shops / boutiques. Staff is always helpful and friendly, just like the entire town. Seal beach is quaint, safe, and a lovely place to visit and live. Friendly locals on every corner. We especially enjoy the breakfast coupon that Pacific Inn includes with your room. You can use the coupon at Hennessy's, located a few blocks from the hotel, and enjoy a
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback! We are so happy you enjoyed your stay and can not wait to have you back!

Summary Heading: Nice Staff, Nice Community.... Old Hotel
Summary: Our family stayed for one week over the 4th of July in the suite room. We paid $200 per night....Kind of expensive for not being on the beach.There was plenty of space in the room for 2 adults and three young kids. There was no kitchenette. The room was obviously not upgraded from the late 70's when it was made. Slightly grungy. The mattresses were nice but worn. The morning breakfast was very basic with a tiny eating area requiring you to eat in your room. The location was 4 city blocks from the beach. A 5-10 minute nice stroll. The pool was very small but the lounge chairs are plush with towels provided. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Seal Beach is a quiet, family community with most of the amenities that you would need for a beach vacation. The only problem is
Manager Response: Thank you sneezenwheez for your review! We are very grateful for your feedback and for bringing some of your concerns  to our attention. We are currently working on updating our amenities to each of our rooms. We continue to be committed to provide you and all our guests with the highest standard of service in the industry. We hope you visit us again soon.

Summary: My daughter and I needed a place to stay overnight near Long Beach Airport. I chose The Pacific Inn based on some great reviews I read here. And I'm so glad we did. The shuttle picked us up promptly at the airport. The pleasant young lady driving the shuttle gave us some great tips for restaurants and things to see in the area. Our room was ready early, so we checked in right away. We changed and got directions to walk to the beach. Very short walk, down a side street with some very beautiful and unusual homes. We really enjoyed Seal Beach, it was not too crowded and very clean.  Our room was very clean and comfortable. The is a Fresh & Easy(small grocery store) right behind the hotel, which was very convenient.The continental breakfast was plenty of food for us. I especially
Manager Response: Thank you sarasdisneym0m for your wonderful review! We are so glad you enjoyed your stay with us and hope you think of us again when you travel to Seal Beach.

Summary: The Pacific Inn is great - friendly and helpful staff, wonderful breakfast, the room was very clean.  The price is pretty good too.  The parking spaces are small if you have a big car but we were able to find a spot on the street nearby.  The hotel is within walking distance (5 minutes) of Main Street - where there are wonderful restaurants and shops.  It is a very nice quiet town.  very restful.  I just wish the hotel had a view of the ocean - then it would be perfect.
Manager Response: Thank you ilovehawaiiredlands for your feedback! I am very pleased you had a great stay with us and would love for you to come back anytime!

Summary Heading: Great stay at The Pacific Inn
Summary: Thank you Trip Advisor and all Pacific Inn reviewers for helping me make the great decision to stay here.  Traveling as a family this was the perfect place to stay before embarking on our cruise to Mexico.  True it is a little dated and worn in the lobby & common areas - the rooms have been re-done and were clean & comfortable.  Quick and safe walk to the beach just 5 minutes away & a McDonalds located across the street ~ It doesn't get much better for families.       They also offer shuttle service (free) to the Long Beach Pier and we were able to save the cost of parking at the pier (which runs $15 a day) Shuttle drives were great and we only had a short wait on our return.  Would positively recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location and close to what matters
Summary: Recommended if you are staying in the area of Seal or Long Beach. Good standard overall. As an alternative to the inhouse continentalbreakfast, a full breakfast at a restaurant outside the hotel was included as an extra bonus.
Manager Response: Thank you RoyKiszka for the positive review of our hotel. We are very pleased to hear that you enjoyed our convenient breakfast as well as one of the many surrounding restaurants. We like to make sure that our guests are well taken care of and like to provide options for breakfast.  We hope you still consider staying with us again when you are in the Seal Beach/Long Beach area.

Summary Heading: The Pacific Inn met and exceeded all of my expectations
Summary: "You had me at Hello!"  All true -- near the beachfront an easy walk to Main Street, the beach and the pier.  I wanted Seal Beach! Wanted something budget but not just cheap! Something with kitsch. Something with funk and fun. Comfort, Friendly. WiFi. Finally after many failed attempts and tired eyes, stumbled upon The Pacific Inn. Could this be true? You never know on the Internet -- so much truth in advertising and false promises. But this looked like the real deal.  Great rates! Great service! Staff is here to please. Small, remodeled use to be Ramada long ago. But this place is off the hook. As soon as I saw the second-floor pool and my room I  had to go down and tell the manager, "You have met and exceeded all of my expectations! Thank you, thank you, thank you!" Not
Manager Response: Thank you CalifTravelinsider for your lovely review! I’m so glad you enjoyed your stay with us. We strive to give every guest the best possible experience, and I’m thrilled that your stay with us exceeded your expectations. We are also happy to hear that you enjoyed all the amenities that our hotel has to offer. We strive to accommodate our guests by providing services that will be beneficial for them. Our staff would be happy to welcome you back again soon, so I hope you’ll think of us when planning your next trip to Seal Beach.

Summary: - 5 nights, business - location OK (near Pacific Coast Highway - reasonable noise, near Seal Beach center - nice walks) - refurbished pool and jacuzzi area (nice) - complimentary shuttle service up to 5 miles (nice!) - clean and large enough rooms - staff helpful at all times (not always friendly, though) - rudimentary breakfast (and: do recycle, please!) - our attempts to save mother nature's resources (by leaving towels on rail instead of on the floor) were consistently ignored by the room service
Manager Response: Hello Daniel M! Thank you for taking the time in writing a review about our hotel. We are happy to hear that you found our rooms, pool & jacuzzi, and shuttle service enjoyable. We apologize if your room location was not ideal because of the street noise. If you do stay with us in the future please let us know and we will make sure to place you in a much quieter room. We will also take into consideration of being more eco-friendly. We appreciate guests who have ideas and suggestions for our hotel. Thanks for being so honest and we hope to see you soon!

Summary Heading: Must have been great in the 70s
Summary: Reasonably priced hotel in Seal Beach.  Everthing in town is in walking distance from the hotel.  Parking is on the ground floor of the building and was great as it rained when we were there.  It is very dated and has a strange bathroom lay out with a sliding glass door.  The beds were good and rooms were clean.  Forget what the call breakfast, unless your dog is hungry--go to town.  This was for business so room time was limited.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Stay there for a week with my wife. Great place walking distance to shops grocery restuarants and THE BEACH
Summary: Stay there for a week with my wife. Great place walking distance to shops grocery restuarants and THE BEACH
Manager Response: Thanks SurfingNLoving for the quick tip! We definitely agree on how convenient it is to walk to the beach, restaurants, and shops. We hope to see you again in the near future!

Summary: Firstly, it was a bit tricky to find, then to find the correct car entrance. Well my hubby calls it a 4* because it's close to his favorite surf spot...I give it a 3. The location is excellent if you want to hang out at the Seal Beach pier area and the main street which contains many excellent eateries and shops. The place is wheel chair accessible and they even have a lift for wheelchairs into the pool.  The pool area or center of the hotel is open, no roof so on a sunny day it is probably great...unfortunately, we had no sun so it was very cold and breezy down the hallways. We actually stayed in 3 different King Bedrooms and all were slightly different, but ok.  The bathrooms have sliding, non-locking doors and only one had a real handle making it easy to open the door upon
Manager Response: none

Summary: We are so happy we did our homework on the Pacific Inn.  We had 3 great nights there before boarding our cruise ship in Long Beach.  If you are looking for a few days break or waiting to board a cruise ship, this is the place for you.   Everything is within walking distance and you don't need a car while there. We had driven there from Las Vegas and returned our vehicle the next day. The hotel offers a complimentary shuttle service and you can just call or pre-arrange your pickup return. The shuttle will even drive you to the cruise terminal.  The rooms are big and have a kitchenette and a balcony. A complimentary continental breakfast is included.  There are very pleasant young ladies working in reception and are a big help with tourist info.   Seal Beach is a hidden gem and
Manager Response: none

Summary: Although this hotel is in a good location and the rooms are spacious, the service and some other issues made my stay unpleasant. I arrived way past check-in time and had to wait at least 45 min. to finally get to my room because it hadn't been cleaned. Other guests in front of me had the same issue. Once I got to the room it was clean, but the furniture and even the bed skirt showed some very evident signs of wear. At night I was woken up several times by noises from the water pipes, which for some reason were very loud when people in the next room used their bathroom. On top of all this, I couldn't used microwave in the room because it was unplugged and there was no way to plug it in, the outlet was behind the heavy tv stand. The TV remote didn't work to turn on the TV either.
Manager Response: none

Summary: not so good at check in had to get worn out cart for luggage an when in room tv didn't work so they changed to a new one . Next morning still couldn't turn on tv thay said it was remote well that was the problem in the first palce.an all they had was remotes with worn out remotes that you couldn't read the # on the remotes an the next morning we went to the continental breakfast an you guessed it canned orange juice breakfast burritos that u had to microwave an the waffle mix was out of order an i told front desk an they said that it was out of order. your workers were painting planters in pool area. an someone was in pool area an mgt didn't no who they were that takes care of safety. an they sort of laughed about they said they had no clue who they were your add said that you
Manager Response: Dear Mr. Carl S.,  Thank you for your review. We take our customers’ problems seriously and are glad to hear from you.
